column2: When Sydney woman Amanda Reid decided to reach out to an old acquaintance in India during a coronavirus lockdown last year, she had no idea she was about to embark on a personal journey of trust, emotion and surprise.

column1: Backlash over 'graphic' COVID-19 ad after first death in Sydney's latest outbreak
column2: Chief Medical Officer Paul Kelly says a new TV ad is intended to be "graphic" to motivate people to get vaccinated, but critics say young Sydneysiders cannot act on the message as the vaccine is not yet widely available to those under the age of 40.

column1: Warning issued after Sydney residents fined for holding parties during lockdown
column2: Over a 24-hour period, 106 fines were handed out to people who attended events such as a card game, a video game gathering and a birthday party.

column1: Victoria shuts border with NSW and ACT amid Sydney coronavirus outbreak
column2: Victorians seeking to return to their home state will need to apply for a red zone permit and will be subject to 14 days of home isolation.

column1: Temporary visa holders call for travel exemptions to include them
column2: Indian parents on temporary visas in Australia are also asking to be considered for travel exemptions so they can be reunited with their children in India.

column1: Victoria celebrates the opening of Australia's first purpose-built LGBTIQ+ centre
column2: Premier Daniel Andrews says the country's first purpose-built LGBTIQ+ centre shows everyone in the community "deserves to be supported and celebrated".
